bHotGasBypass1: Envelope control is optional for 19 DV.
bHotGasBypass2: It connects condenser and cooler directly as the photo shows, The purpose of adding envelope control is to make chiller operate stably at low load. Envelope control can provide enough mass flow to enhance compressor operating stability when compressor unloads to very low load by bypassing part of discharged refrigerant vapor flow to compressor suction port.
bHotGasBypass3: If you have any special request on this , please contact with local marketing team.
bLiquidBypass2: In 19DV chiller, two float ball valves are installed in high side chamber and low side chamber to provide throttling relay (from condenser pressure to cooler pressure). At low lift application, liquid bypass option will bypass low side float ball valve to achieve higher liquid driven force and ultimately feeding cooler with enough liquid supply.
bLiquidBypass3: Very low ECWT leads to a low pressure difference between condenser and cooler. Refrigerant flow is driven by the pressure difference, which means lower driven force will result in a lower refrigerant flow rate. Eventually, without enough liquid supply, cooler will be dry while excessive refrigerant liquid is stacked in condenser or economizer chamber. Therefore, chiller will easily get tripped out due to low evaporating temperature alarm.
bLiquidBypass4: If you have any special request on this , please contact with local marketing team.
